content.raw:
Personally, if I put time into learning about a project and setting it up, and eventually find out it doesn't work as advertised, I'm turned away from it. How can I trust any of the documentation from then on? Will the API work as documented? Are any of the features actually available?

I think being clear upfront about what the project does and where it's heading is good to develop a good relationship with the community. An under construction sign can be an invitation to come collaborate, give feedback and check in again later.

My 2 cents.
